title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: The hit applied very well, for Muirhead was a wind-dried, unhealthy looking little man, very proud of his genealogy, and ambitious of being acknowledged, on all occasions, as the chief of the Muirheads! He was not disposed, however, to sit down with the affront : on the contrary, he replied to it in a virulent diatribe, which may be presented as a remarkable specimen of clerical and poetical irritability ; and curious, moreover
